SOUTHCOM 's mission is not a major priority for the U.S. government and , given tensions in other areas , it may not be farfetched to predict a reduction of U.S. military personnel deployed to its bases in Honduras , El Salvador or even the closure of either the base in Aruba or Curacao .

With that said , a full closure of these bases will most likely not happen either as it is important for the U.S. to have a minimal presence in the region in order to have the means to crack down on transnational crimes like drug trafficking , along with maintaining an ever - watchful eye on the region .
